question.content:
Select **ALL** of the following people who emerged as critics of the Constitution during the battle over its ratification.

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.clue: Elbridge Gerry was an Anti-Federalist who opposed the ratification of the Constitution due to concerns about centralized power. Although he attended the Constitutional Convention, he refused to sign the Constitution at the end of its proceedings.
Mercy Otis Warren was an Anti-Federalist who opposed the ratification of the Constitution, primarily due to concerns about individual liberties.
Samuel Adams, despite his role in advocating for independence, emerged as a critic of the Constitution.
Benjamin Franklin supported the Constitution. He attended the Constitutional Convention and supported the ratification of the Constitution.
